text: The Don whitefin gudgeon (Romanogobio tanaiticus)Kottelat, M. and J. Freyhof, 2007. Handbook of European freshwater fishes. Publications Kottelat, Cornol, Switzerland. 646 p. is a species of freshwater fish in the family Cyprinidae. It is distributed in the Don River basin in Russia, and also in the Siverskyi Donets River in Ukraine. The maximal length is 10.7 cm, maximal reported age 5 years. ==References== ==Sources== * Category:Romanogobio Category:Freshwater fish of Europe Category:Fish of Russia Category:Fish described in 2001
title: Don whitefin gudgeon
